Test reply #2.  No image edition.

test reply

Edit:  test edit

Edit 2:  Test edit 2
Testing with peers.
Testing.
I see you.

>>c95b261a-b071-44ca-943d-856436dcbb46

Testing something.

>>dddd3ebd-f9ad-493d-b23b-b6459a4e2e28

Let's hope not, but that's what this place is for.

Nope.  I'll be keeping it active for a while until everyone knows about it.  Even if its down, I'll bring it up at the first sign of trouble with 8chan.

The master seed is just a Python script that I leave running in the background.  Its not even necessary as long as some people are online and using the site.

If you're wondering why its slow, the bunker info wasn't released outside the GG threads.  Its supposed to be an apocalypse bunker if 8chan dies, not a casual hangout.  If you guys WANT to use it for that, feel free.

If things got bad and it looked like 8chan might die, we'd be spreading that infograph fucking everywhere.

Cool.  /a/ has their own bunker on smuglo.li, but I wonder where everyone else is?

Who am I kidding, theyre playing games and fapping to traps.
Testing replies.

>>1a6ab4fd-3da3-4c64-a221-654f3ca7d191

Thanks for the test help!
Test.

So being the board owner doesn't actually let you manage anything except your own computer.  Your login is basically irrelevant since it only cares about your ID hash, which will either be the same for every post (owner or not) and which you can change with the zeronet sidebar.

Testing upload.

So yeah, all it is is that the file will be blank when nobody is seeding it.  If you open it yourself it should load (from your own machine).

When other people have saved it and are online, you'll be able to see it.  Like right now it appears blank to me because you aren't online and I don't have it saved yet.

I saw this on Twitter earlier.  Fucking Cloudflare!

Never give up, anons.
Time to start sharing these with trusted places, I think.

>>51b2f8e8-7286-41e8-9432-b6c0530fa71a

A blank image is what you see if an image was posted, but nobody currently online has a copy of it to seed.  You get a blank placeholder.

As soon as someone accesses the site who has the image, it will load properly again.  And once you've seen it once it will always load, because you are seeding it too.

>>7004b89e-272b-4802-b729-2afec1af7e52

No, that's actually odd.  You should always see images you upload yourself.

Under the Browse for file button on a new post, does it have a bunch of random looking characters ending in "@08chan"?

Pic post test.

>>3fc1caf6-6a70-4d63-82db-8f1e0287d464

Its possible.  Everything seems to be working fine on this end.  Try this:

Go into your Zeronet folder, and look under /data and the file beginning in 1DdPH.  Go into /data, then /users and then look for your folder.  Itll be the one beginning with the same string as what you see under the Browse button.  Is the pic you uploaded saved in that folder?

>>ddd1ed08-1174-4bc2-b608-52d49ad22530

All the images in the folder are blank, or the folder is empty of images?

>>bbee4c20-81c0-4808-b14a-ca13342931f9

Check their properties.  Do any of them have a file size?

>>8671e11b-26c3-4184-a861-f6de40ac875c

So the images uploaded and stored in your folder, but it sounds like they got corrupted somehow since they aren't all just 0kb placeholders.

Can you normally use bittorrent to upload and download stuff?  Zeronet uses the BT protocol for everything, so it could be a network configuration issue or an ISP issue (fucking Comcast).  Other than that its possible you have a bugged install.  Whatever it is, its local to your system.

>>8671e11b-26c3-4184-a861-f6de40ac875c

Can you see pics other people post?

>>6235f08c-eae8-456b-a98b-ec1a9a34303b

Check your router configuration too, if you have one.  Make sure its not cockblocking you.

>>2a4e324d-2f87-4702-8bac-9a63f803862e

It doesn't really have one.  Your personal Zeronet install will have a max limit for files you download and seed set in the "0" drag menu in the top right of the screen, but since everything is sent over Bittorrent there's no real max file size limit for posting.

>>f4869bc4-a8b4-4c89-9e40-80a4aeaf3d1c

We lurkin, we watching, and we waitin.

>>ac9f3acc-d221-4510-b79b-dd2fc0136b0f

Its true.  Setting up ZN is easier than setting up a LAN game on a Windows 98 computer.

I look at it as a mild positive.  Since getting in here takes a little effort, it'll weed out 90% of the retards we wouldn't want anyway.

>>d032e6f1-f73f-4a2f-8e20-04344979d24b

That's exactly what's happening.  We had quite a few people here today, testing posting and even board creation.  Those people then carry the seed of the site, making sure it stays alive if others need to come.

>>43dfb71c-dccd-4756-ac9a-ca7475071619

Have faith.  Codemonkey says the main site will be fine, but we can post here in the meantime.

>>9081df2c-ca18-44c7-9adb-d6078c59a6ee

I do.  I just woke up to see what happened with 8chan and bitmitigate.  Still taking it all in and catching up on whats been happening.

Hotwheels really went all-in on betraying us, didn't he?

>>9ddb6b95-0c03-46e1-81d1-3bc9efeca29c

I think so.  So let me tell you a bit about how this place was made.  I created a clone of millchan since they had the most proven build of the Nullchan framework, and then added a bunch of bugfixes and a couple hacks based on Nullchan's original code.  Everything was tested and working fine at that point, though I seemed to miss the "blank files uploading from TOR" bug.  About two months after I did this, Millchan completely revamped their site.

I can update the cloned code using Zeronet's functionality, but I get a warning that it will overwrite any custom code that I have implemented.  I never did it since the site was working fine and I was rather afraid of the process breaking everything and going to hell.  Stability was my number one priority.  (imagine the chaos right now if I did the update and it suddenly broke everything).

I can, and will do the update if its really necessary, but there are risks.

>>efd65961-5b46-4dbb-b57e-335236d3dbb3

Accidentally clicked my own (you).

There are "board owners" but we have no effective power.  We can "blacklist" thumbnails for things like CP, but all that means is they don't auto-load when you access the page.  You can still click the link and get them.  Owners can't delete content, ban users, or anything of the sort like they can on a normal site.  Posting with a capcode is a vestigial function, mostly  for official announcements about the site.
There's a now-known bug in uploading images via TOR.  I'm discussing with users what to do about it.

>>fb95d1c9-d5a5-41c8-858e-867a1e9f4045

If we wind up here for more than a day or two, I'll get my ass to work on QoL upgrades.  Similarly I'll look at manually upgrading the code as suggested by >>11626640-332b-4a2d-a628-0b516f314744

>>9cb6c756-79a8-4e7a-8d32-832251d3cb43

You can test the feature yourself.  The core code cloned from Millchan isn't actually that old - it was taken from right before their last major revamp, and bugfixes were applied.  I tested the Mute function on 08chan and it worked fine.  I think we have some Millchan users hoping to grow their own community by taking us in.  Its fine if people want to go that route, but this place was made by 8chan, for 8chan.  If truly needed, we will improve this place as we go.

>>ba89c97f-9398-4190-a4e4-eee2eae78da4

Unfortunately no.  A code upgrade will fix that, but feel free to post without TOR for a time - your ID hash is encrypted no matter what, TOR is just an extra layer on top of that.

>>2431db76-7e34-4206-abaf-8d57ffae8376
I rather like it as well.  There's no "moderation responsibility" since we can't moderate anyway.  Its all on the users.

posts.subject: Announcement and Ongoing Issues
posts.body:
==UPDATE:  NEW SITE UPDATE HAS GONE LIVE==

==UPDATE:  JIM'S HEARING IS SCHEDULED FOR SEPTEMBER 5TH.  8CHAN IS STATED TO RETURN SHORTLY AFTER IT IS OVER.==

Nice to meet you, I created 08chan.

There's a lot of uncertainty right now, but please try to keep a cool head.  I'm sure everyone is following the happenings with 8chan, but the current score is that Bitmitigate got deplatformed by their own service providers, and Ron and the other 8chan staff are working on an alternative.  In the meantime, a whole shitload of people came here - exactly what 08chan is for.

==Known Issues==

==Posting errors between ZeroID certs and old 08chan certs should be fixed now.  If you get an error that your post size is more than 0 bites, delete Zeronet and start with a fresh install.  Get a new ZeroID from a clean IP address, and everything should work fine.==

>Image uploading via TOR is currently broken.  A temp fix for thumbnails was found, but there is a permanent solution to be found in upgrading 08chan's base code.  This must be done very carefully to not cripple the site, and some anons from /tech/ are experimenting with it.

>~~If we're here for more than a few days, we will start implementing quality of life improvements and code upgrades.~~  It seems we're going to be stuck here for a while so we're going to move forward with this.

>The Mute function has been working fine since the time of the last tests.  To Unmute a user, go to ZeroHello and access the large "3 vertical dots" menu in the upper left corner, and choose "Manage Blocked Users".  Feel free to test the Mute functionality and make sure it is working properly.  Report bugs here.

>Zeronet as a whole is not fully compatible with certain browsers like Opera, and there's nothing we can do about that.  I'm sorry.

>Script blockers can have a terrible effect on basic site functions.  Make sure you whitelist the site in Noscript and other systems.

>Gab launched a Tweetchain about this site in the early hours of August 6th, which exploded on Twitter.  Site traffic is currently ramping up by the hour.  If the site is slowing down for you, consider enabling the "Download and Help Distribute All Files" option in your 0 menu with a limit of 500mb and a file size limit of 20mb.  This will speed the site back up to its normal rate at the cost of some disk space.

==IT IS STRONGLY RECOMMENDED THAT YOU POST AND BROWSE ONLY VIA TOR OR A VPN.==
The Daily Beast published a hitpiece about us today that revealed (((certain people))) are harvesting IPs from concurrent connections for purposes unknown. 

==THE SITE NOW REQUIRES A ZEROID CERTIFICATE TO POST==
This ID can be acquired by using ZeroNet over the clearnet just long enough to visit 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ 
This will give you a new, one-time certificate so you can post.  To activate it, get the cert and then open the "0" menu in the upper right, and select Change next to "Identity Address."  Choose the ZeroID cert.  Update the site, reload the page and be patient and you should be able to post again.  

>It is possible to run all of ZeroNet from inside a Veracrypt Encrypted File Container.  I strongly recommend making such a container and only mounting it during the times you are using ZeroNet, and unmounting it when you finish.  This is slightly RAM-intensive, so it may not be an option if you have a toaster, but will give you maximum personal protection if you inadvertently download something you shouldn't have.

==I HAVE ALSO IDENTIFIED A BUG IN THE [M] FUNCTION.==

 If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them.  If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted.  If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters.  Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually.

We've had no other bug reports apart from the slowness caused by so many leechers, but I found this a bit ago when I muted a porn spammer on /b/ as a test.  His folder had over 1000 files in it between thumbnails and images from a single thread.  We will investigate this bug as well.

==UPDATE:  NEW SITE UPDATE HAS GONE LIVE==

==UPDATE:  JIM'S HEARING IS SCHEDULED FOR SEPTEMBER 5TH.  8CHAN IS STATED TO RETURN SHORTLY AFTER IT IS OVER.==

Nice to meet you, I created 08chan.

There's a lot of uncertainty right now, but please try to keep a cool head.  I'm sure everyone is following the happenings with 8chan, but the current score is that Bitmitigate got deplatformed by their own service providers, and Ron and the other 8chan staff are working on an alternative.  In the meantime, a whole shitload of people came here - exactly what 08chan is for.

==Known Issues==

==Posting errors between ZeroID certs and old 08chan certs should be fixed now.  If you get an error that your post size is more than 0 bites, delete Zeronet and start with a fresh install.  Get a new ZeroID from a clean IP address, and everything should work fine.==

>~~If we're here for more than a few days, we will start implementing quality of life improvements and code upgrades.  It seems we're going to be stuck here for a while so we're going to move forward with this.~~ First major update has been applied.

>The Mute function has been working fine since the time of the last tests.  To Unmute a user, go to ZeroHello and access the large "3 vertical dots" menu in the upper left corner, and choose "Manage Blocked Users".  Feel free to test the Mute functionality and make sure it is working properly.  Report bugs here.

>Zeronet as a whole is not fully compatible with certain browsers like Opera and Pale Moon, and there's nothing we can do about that.  I'm sorry.

>Script blockers can have a terrible effect on basic site functions.  Make sure you whitelist the site in Noscript and other systems.

>Gab launched a Tweetchain about this site in the early hours of August 6th, which exploded on Twitter.  Site traffic is currently ramping up by the hour.  If the site is slowing down for you, consider enabling the "Download and Help Distribute All Files" option in your 0 menu with a limit of 500mb and a file size limit of 20mb.  This will speed the site back up to its normal rate at the cost of some disk space.

==IT IS STRONGLY RECOMMENDED THAT YOU POST AND BROWSE ONLY VIA TOR OR A VPN.==
The Daily Beast published a hitpiece about us On August 10th that revealed (((certain people))) are harvesting IPs from concurrent connections for purposes unknown. 

==THE SITE NOW REQUIRES A ZEROID CERTIFICATE TO POST==
This ID can be acquired by using ZeroNet over the clearnet just long enough to visit 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ 
This will give you a new, one-time certificate so you can post.  To activate it, get the cert and then open the "0" menu in the upper right, and select Change next to "Identity Address."  Choose the ZeroID cert.  Update the site, reload the page and be patient and you should be able to post again.  

==It is possible to run all of ZeroNet from inside a Veracrypt Encrypted File Container. ==
I strongly recommend making such a container and only mounting it during the times you are using ZeroNet, and unmounting it when you finish.  This is slightly RAM-intensive, so it may not be an option if you have a toaster, but will give you maximum personal protection if you inadvertently download something you shouldn't have.

==I HAVE ALSO IDENTIFIED A BUG IN THE [M] FUNCTION.==

 If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them.  If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted.  If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters.  Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually.

==THE SITE NOW REQUIRES A ZEROID CERTIFICATE TO POST==
This ID can be acquired by using ZeroNet over the clearnet just long enough to visit 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ 
This will give you a new, one-time certificate so you can post.  To activate it, get the cert and then open the "0" menu in the upper right, and select Change next to "Identity Address."  Choose the ZeroID cert.  Update the site, reload the page and be patient and you should be able to post again.  

==It is possible to run all of ZeroNet from inside a Veracrypt Encrypted File Container. ==
I strongly recommend making such a container and only mounting it during the times you are using ZeroNet, and unmounting it when you finish.  This is slightly RAM-intensive, so it may not be an option if you have a toaster, but will give you maximum personal protection if you inadvertently download something you shouldn't have.

==I HAVE ALSO IDENTIFIED A BUG IN THE [M] FUNCTION.==

 If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them.  If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted.  If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters.  Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually.

>>4907eda5-9004-47a4-b74f-17921e0fba91

Its a consequence of the system, anon.  PERSEC is always your responsibility.

>>d0bfd45c-06ef-45a8-9423-7ca3cd8e44cd

Works fine.

>>405e9ddb-2836-4ae0-bed7-4271e27edbf5
>>a020c8c5-a911-476d-a330-6f82d6c14aab
>>17c9fbf3-1352-42d3-b68f-766bb59d5951
>>36f31eb8-4798-46f5-bbb2-210225d9f61b

If you want to "break the chain" in your post history from time to time, you can get a new cert from the 0 menu in the upper right corner by hitting "Change" on your Identity Address, nulling it, and then reloading the site to get a new one.

Its a consequence of how Zeronet works.  In order to be able to block a CP spammer, your own system has to be able to see what he's posted to blacklist it.  There's no getting around this - Zeronet doesn't work like normal Internet does.  That makes it censorship proof, but it also means "post histories" (actually hash seed contents) have to be saved on your machine.

I have work, but I'll be checking back regularly to view bug reports, complaints, and to answer questions.  

Never, ever give up.  We'll survive this, and I think we'll get our home back before its over.  If we don't, we'll turn this place into a darknet paradise.  Nobody here is alone.
Check the announcement.

>>b2d9dd33-f54f-4339-b63c-241a959a8d66

The blacklist feature is a psudeo-ban.  Anyone who wants can still click and see the content the blacklisted user posted.  It just won't appear and be saved to your computer by default - not even thumbnails.

For the record, I have no intention of using it unless in dire emergency, like a CP spambot or something.  This entire site is designed to be self-moderated.  I want YOU controlling what you see, and no one else.

Edit:  This extends to "moderators" as well.  There will be none.  The power is in your hands.

>>0e588adc-cb2f-4239-92ac-01248f252491

This is exactly how it works.  Everyone is seeding the site, so the more connections there are on the network, the faster everything works.

>>da297251-8190-4447-a7ca-0842c585b205

There are over a thousand people using the site right now, according to my end.

>>bc829a3c-17a0-42f9-a44f-d289a3014a0b

Noted.  I'll look into that as a QOL upgrade if we all wind up staying long enough.

>>420a69cd-5755-4809-98a5-b89931e132fa

Noted.

>>44ae165b-1323-4180-8629-b63b8731f20e

I'm honored.  Thank you.

>>f1e7658a-21f1-4336-9d77-d12b58816090

Yes.  I picked Zeronet because it was the only proven, distributed imageboard system that could be done.  You don't take chances with experimental stuff when you're making an apocalypse bunker, and imageboards using Zeronet had already been created.  In fact this site was created by taking core code from the most proven of those sites, and hacking in some custom features and bug fixes.  I'm loathe to mess with it since it just works, and fucking up any of the weird Zeronet code can kill the whole site easily.  If upgrades come, it will be slow, careful, and with some experienced help.

>>4472a85c-caa1-4f3a-b420-ac2549d0b71d

No one can see your IP, including myself.

There is some danger in what you post because every post you make is saved in your hash folder on every computer that seeds your content.  So if you screw up and leave a trail of personal information breadcrumbs across many posts that could piece together who you are, then someone could theoretically put those pieces together and identify you.  But the same could be said about post history on something like a forum, or even on 8chan if a janitor was after you.

Practice good PERSEC and don't use the site like Facebook.

>>0d494291-ce2f-443f-9bb5-397581e5587f 
Correct.

>>e23bc82c-6430-4af7-9711-9b7894553ae1

Go into your Zeronet folder, and then /data.  Then go into the folder starting with 1DdPH, and then into the /data folder there.  Look for the folder there that has the same hash as what you see in the "0 menu" in the top right under "Identity Address."  That folder will contain everything you ever post.

>>893dce0a-efa2-4ef7-9c54-fd71b0b00115

Since all traffic is routed over the Bittorrent Network, my understanding is that IPs can't be identified.  I can promise you that even as admin I have no functionality to view a user's IP address.

If there is a roundabout way to do it by monitoring a computer's peer to peer connections on the BT network somehow (and there may be, I'm an imageboard user and not a professional hacker) then there could be a risk.

Either way a VPN should solve the issue entirely.

>>3b37ba6a-d4a1-4888-8ead-6211c8a45616

Go to Zerohello and click the "3 vertical dots" in the upper left corner.  Scroll down and choose "Manage Blocklists".
9/11 I like it.

>>3ac5474b-0859-4d24-8b04-32ac2c886aa5

Nothing is wrong with it anon, but we have self-declared mortal enemies who will never leave us alone to have that fun.

Only you're now in maybe the one place they can't touch you.  So have fun here until the main site comes back up.  As long as we have this place as a fallback (and we always will, because destroying it is all but impossible), then we can ride out any storm.

I once told HW that he saved us in 2014, and no matter what he did or said he would never be hated and loathed by everyone the way moot was.  This was about 2 years ago, when he was at a low point in his life.

I choose to see the HW of 2014 and the HW of today as two separate people.  The Hotwheels I knew would have been the first person to call the current Hotwheels a fucking faggot with no principles.

>>91e64d97-cf3f-4832-a856-8c5729c9d512

Because this site is a custom hack of that same software, and that change wasn't implemented until after this one was made.  Stability and basic functions were the only priorities.  This site works.  Upgrades can be done to it as time goes by, but for an emergency bunker serving as a reprieve from a completely unexpected catastrophe it's doing very well so far.

>>042827cf-01aa-486e-a4d0-e8dc0b51f8fa

Here's the best part - as long as even one person, even (you) are browsing the site, then the site is up for everyone.  There's no server to take down, no plug to pull.  Its small and comfy, but its also eternal.  No matter what happens to 8chan, this place will be here.

>>3df33a03-77e8-41fb-bb87-3fb479e24da3

If that's true, I'd sure be interested in working on further development with you.  Right now stability is my #1 priority, but upgrades and changes would come by necessity if the site stays active over time.

Think it over and we can swap emails later if you're interested.

>>93cfd36c-3bae-406d-b3fa-15e80735efeb
Correct.  As long as even one person is using the site, they are seeding it to everyone else who drops by.  No servers, no hosting providers, no DNS, no bandwidth bills, nothing.  They can spam it, and you can wash all the spam away with a single click.  Even if I walked off and disappeared forever right now, the site wouldn't change at all.  We are eternal.

>>857c3450-bc5a-48dd-b9be-37a4f81e9339

In the "0 menu" on the right, make sure the "Download and seed all site content" is set to off.

Then you only download and seed what you explicitly see as you browse.

>>19cd75c0-20d4-4ea9-aeef-26460f00e15e

Since its distributed P2P, the more users there are, the better it works.  Its the exact opposite of a normal website.

>>f37e5039-559a-4ed4-9f03-bf9829e6d287
>no, it may not work on this particular site as it is outdated when comparing to Millchan where the blacklisting/mutting feature works to delete data on ones drive: 

Users here have been testing the Mute function and it deletes all images properly.  Try it for yourself and don't post misinformation.

>>405b0c8f-5d66-4939-8b1f-b0574293967b

What are they gonna shoah?  There's no server.  No content provider.  No webhost.  No domain name.  No payment processor.

They have no targets.  No one to pressure.  The site infrastructure is like a ghost, because its divided up between.. *checks* 1774 people.  Even China can't stop Zeronet, and they have tried hard.

We win.  They lose.  Get comfy.

>>d5d57a70-5e5e-4185-95db-4b1c2b6d6ec3
>>fb21f58e-d9bf-4f49-9f14-de7545a681db

Learn a bit more about the site before trying to manage a board.  The code ending in @08chan is your cert hash as a board owner.  Basically your "username", if the site could be said to have something like that.

Board owners have almost no power.  You can post with a capcode, sticky a thread, or add a user to the opt-in Blacklist to stop their posts from loading automatically.  That's all.  Ownership of a board is not easily transferred either, and has to be done via offsite methods like email.

>>7f6630ae-4e9e-4b3d-a47e-4df52f78bfb6

Those assholes you'll never have to worry about again. Welcome to freedom, for however long its needed.

>>61d8fd86-bfa2-44ce-9372-0a2527d5ee21

Scroll down to the bottom of the page.  See the little checkbox that says "enable Blacklist"?  If you, the user, have that box checked, then if I use the "blacklist user" option on a poster, then you will no longer see the blacklisted user's posts.  If you uncheck that box and reload the page, you will see  all posts, including those by users that I have blacklisted.  That's why I call it a pseudo-ban.  They're only "banned" from people who don't want to see them, but who haven't already muted them themselves for some reason.  That's why I have no expectation of using the blacklist feature.  You have the ability to take care of yourselves on moderation here.

>>d72120c0-7244-4897-9a36-108ea7c2eaf7

There have been one or two people saying this since we blew up.  The core code of the site was indeed cloned from Millchan (because it was the most stable of the Zeronet imageboards), but several bugfixes and a few hacks based on the original Nullchan code were applied to it to create 08chan.

A couple months after this was done, Millchan did a complete redesign of their site.  This place was already working perfectly in every test I and some anons performed, so we opted for "if it isn't broken, don't try to fix it."  For instance, we've already had some anons testing the new Millchan who say the [M] function doesn't always delete everything its supposed to, where ours does.

I think its someone who wants to drive some of our traffic to Millchan's community, but that's conjecture on my part.  I have no ill will to the Millchan peeps, but 08chan is 08chan.  We're our own thing.

>>10d16558-e2d3-4806-9853-e7cc8f7d64ca

Reports are that their Mute function doesn't work as well as ours.  For a site that has actual CP posted on it, that would be very important.  Other than that, why would we go somewhere when we have a site made by 8chan, for 8chan?

posts.subject: Announcement and Ongoing Issues
posts.body:
Nice to meet you, I created 08chan.

There's a lot of uncertainty right now, but please try to keep a cool head.  I'm sure everyone is following the happenings with 8chan, but the current score is that Bitmitigate got deplatformed by their own service providers, and Ron and the other 8chan staff are working on an alternative.  In the meantime, a whole shitload of people came here - exactly what 08chan is for.

==Known Issues==

>Image uploading via TOR is currently broken.  A temp fix for thumbnails was found, but there is a permanent solution to be found in upgrading 08chan's base code.  This must be done very carefully to not cripple the site, and some anons from /tech/ are experimenting with it.

>~~If we're here for more than a few days, we will start implementing quality of life improvements and code upgrades.~~  It seems we're going to be stuck here for a while so we're going to move forward with this.

>The Mute function has been working fine since the time of the last tests.  To Unmute a user, go to ZeroHello and access the large "3 vertical dots" menu in the upper left corner, and choose "Manage Blocked Users".  Feel free to test the Mute functionality and make sure it is working properly.  Report bugs here.

>Zeronet as a whole is not fully compatible with certain browsers like Opera, and there's nothing we can do about that.  I'm sorry.

>Script blockers can have a terrible effect on basic site functions.  Make sure you whitelist the site in Noscript and other systems.

>Gab launched a Tweetchain about this site in the early hours of August 6th, which exploded on Twitter.  Site traffic is currently ramping up by the hour.  If the site is slowing down for you, consider enabling the "Download and Help Distribute All Files" option in your 0 menu with a limit of 500mb and a file size limit of 20mb.  This will speed the site back up to its normal rate at the cost of some disk space.

==IT IS STRONGLY RECOMMENDED THAT YOU POST AND BROWSE ONLY VIA TOR OR A VPN.==
The Daily Beast published a hitpiece about us today that revealed (((certain people))) are harvesting IPs from concurrent connections for purposes unknown. 

==THE SITE NOW REQUIRES A ZEROID CERTIFICATE TO POST==
This ID can be acquired by using ZeroNet over the clearnet just long enough to visit 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ 
This will give you a new, one-time certificate so you can post.  To activate it, get the cert and then open the "0" menu in the upper right, and select Change next to "Identity Address."  Choose the ZeroID cert.  Update the site, reload the page and be patient and you should be able to post again.  We are attempting a fix to allow new users to access old content from before this change.

>It is possible to run all of ZeroNet from inside a Veracrypt Encrypted File Container.  I strongly recommend making such a container and only mounting it during the times you are using ZeroNet, and unmounting it when you finish.  This is slightly RAM-intensive, so it may not be an option if you have a toaster, but will give you maximum personal protection if you inadvertently download something you shouldn't have.

==I HAVE ALSO IDENTIFIED A BUG IN THE [M] FUNCTION.==

 If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them.  If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted.  If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters.  Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually.

We've had no other bug reports apart from the slowness caused by so many leechers, but I found this a bit ago when I muted a porn spammer on /b/ as a test.  His folder had over 1000 files in it between thumbnails and images from a single thread.  We will investigate this bug as well.

This will speed the site back up to its normal rate at the cost of some disk space.

>>c6d39134-e2f5-4878-a665-2b524ea533cd

You don't sage the thread, you [M] it.  Poof, gone, and the other threads slide back up.

>>2d108065-be55-43c3-9753-aacadddf0f3c

In the unlikely event we wind up staying here for a long time, yes.  

I honestly expected 8chan to be back up by now, so the initial focus will always be on provable, stable workarounds for bugs, but I'm starting to piece together a possible longer-term plan to ensure the site's integrity and quality of life if it comes to that. Right now multiple anons have stated across 4 boards that the above tweak to TOR browser fixes it, so we're going with that route for the moment.

>>677dadde-8abc-4c1f-b45f-182ac6439209

I'm going to try and make fixing this my next goal starting tomorrow.  I'll be tinkering with solutions from a test account and clone site.

>>79579c58-584b-428f-86a5-6509841ec739

Lurkers.  We have nearly four thousand people seeding the site as peers, but only about 73 posters connected at a time.  Yesterday concurrent connections were quite a bit higher.

Mother of God.  I just got home from work and we still have over 4000 peers on the network.  I was hoping Ron's statements would have scared some of the newfags off to lighten the load but it hasn't settled down any.

I have a plan and a schedule.  I'll be taking some time off work this weekend to investigate the TOR thumbnail issue first, and then I'm going to seek development help from here and Millchan for site QoL improvements.  In the meantime I suggest everyone either post via TOR or a (free) VPN.

This will be added up top but I'm posting it here as well. 

==I HAVE ALSO IDENTIFIED A BUG IN THE [M] FUNCTION.==

 If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them.  If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted.  If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters.  Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually.

We've had no other bug reports apart from the slowness caused by so many leechers, but I found this a bit ago when I muted a porn spammer on /b/ as a test.  His folder had over 1000 files in it between thumbnails and images from a single thread.  We will investigate this bug as well.

>>55c0e481-8bc5-48cc-ae85-de1c7e3a1d9a

I've been discussing this across some of the various threads, and it would most likely render the site unusable to attempt a "code upgrade" using the Zeronet function.  Certain fixes from Millchan and other homebrew bugfixes will be applied soon.  The TOR image posting and the large-folder mute bug first and foremost.

In the meantime, you can switch to a decent VPN to solve the issue if you want.  That's what I've been doing from the start.

>>431efc74-1b43-4c92-9f55-2ebe71ebda0e
By the end of the weekend.  I'm looking into some suggested upgrades over on /tech/ right now.  They've been discussing this at some length today.

>>3282e716-53d1-4b90-8294-ccdb5f51ffe6
I'm happy to use whatever stable solutions work.  Function over form, and no pride invested.

>>ea25825e-c9f9-474b-a52b-15c31bf115d0
I have no comment on discussions other than keeping this place alive, and before this is over I hope to never use so much as this capcode again. Anon means anon.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
Am I correct in asserting that I could make these updates to the main build and then just publish it across the network to everyone like normal?

How well tested are these, and has there been any detrimental effect, no matter how small, to using them?

Thank you for posting this here.

posts.subject: Update:
posts.body:
The site's still alive, even under this ridiculous load.  Metrics showed us spike to over 7000 peers earlier today.

There are some bright minds on /pol/ and /tech/ working on porting major upgrades to the site, and I'm investigating the premise.  I plan to skip work this weekend and see if a key bug fix and some QoL upgrades can be feasibly implemented before Monday.

Thank you all for being here.  We're gonna make it.

>>f3f6bec7-14dd-4550-a051-b4b798a99ed5
Being considered and discussed right now.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
I'd like to ask you guys for a favor.  Keep playing with this and see if you can break it and I'll run this thread by the other top boards among my updates to have them try.

If it seems fully solid by the weekend and people are okay with it, I'll do a backup and implement it sitewide for everyone.  This place was partly my idea, but cloning and hacking some code is different than knowing all the ins and outs, and /tech/ are the champs at that.

posts.subject: Approaching Over 9000 peers
posts.body:
I've found a few things out.

1:  I no longer suggest accessing the site without at least a VPN.  Even if you're diligent about illegal material, we are now in the direct crosshairs.

2:  Testing a few free VPNs, and ProtonVPN will block you for too much p2p traffic.

3:  You can run ZeroNet entirely from a Veracrypt Encrypted Container file.  If you wish to run Download and Share All Files I suggest doing so for protection.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>6ab9c4db-26f4-408f-86ba-548c5aa01625

I can't use my capcode since I'm not the board owner.  There's no capcode for site admin.  But you can check my ID and compare it to the one who made the first few boards to verify.

==I'M KEEPING TABS ON THE PROGRESS IN THIS THREAD.  IF YOU GUYS GET A DEFINITIVE ANSWER, IT CAN BE PUT INTO ACTION SIDEWIDE.==

Please don't give up.  This would, frankly, take me forever to get right on my own, and I have a lot of RL responsibilities that eat up my time.  The timing on this disaster was awful.

>>4b715753-16a8-485a-93bc-0b5e364fb83b
I knew they would want to go that far, but I didn't think they'd have the stones to try this soon.

>>e65979fa-51b5-4874-831d-9f8e9dcd1205
Where can we read more about this?

posts.subject: FYI - useful bit of info
posts.body: You can run Zeronet entirely from a Veracrypt Encrypted Container.  Make one on a big empty drive about 30gb in size and move your Zeronet install into it, then try running it like normal.  It slows down posting a tiny bit, but as long as you unmount the container when you're done browsing, you have a huge layer of protection for anything you upload or download.

posts.subject: Spam Safe Harbor Chat Sticky
posts.body:
Now looking into any kind of captcha implementations.

Thank our new friend, they'll help make the site much better in the end. :^)

>>8ae93e3e-5f54-42e9-818f-2228c5e5c927

Looks like research has been conducted since 2016 into BTC-based decentralized captcha, but nothing has been implemented on a site like this.  Use the stickies to talk in the meantime and just post in good threads to bump them occasionally.   I'm working on a solution.

>>045f0bb9-0f26-46dc-ac4d-248eafdd4e57
Making sure the top threads don't get slid by the spammer.

>>346db389-976c-42d6-96d3-7779f6bb6eb8
>>e3e55715-f91d-4a41-9ee1-5d646f64dabe

The problem with making our content uncensorable to anyone is that spammers get the same advantages.  Ride out the storm.

>>80c7f1ab-08e8-4eb4-8f05-ef1b2f175b7d

I've asked about it on Millchan's /dev/ as well.  There's nothing on the clearnet, and captcha has never been implemented because its extremely hard to decentralize.  Spam is a known issue on Zeronet, apparently.

For now all we can do is ride the storm and hope coders better than me can give us a hand.  

==I would like to add a long wait time to generate a new certificate, and I'm investigating that possibility now.  If you can help, please help.==
The code is a mess of uncommented javascript.  I'm trying to find a way to add a multi-minute delay between user posts but I'm not getting anywhere.

posts.subject: Testing spam mitigation
posts.body:
==I AM ATTEMPTING TO DISABLE SELF-GENERATED CERTIFICATES==

You can go to ZeroID at http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ to generate a new cert.  Switch to that cert in the 0 menu on the right and use it to resume posting.

Note that this will lock you to one cert.

Consider installing Veracrypt and running Zeronet from a large encrypted file to protect yourself.

>>71374d2f-ff59-47d4-a39c-e142e0c8f93a

I already have an idea for this.  Apparently its possible for an individual site to set up an IP-based cert provider like what ZeroID is.  Ours would have a bit different rules though.  Something like 1IP per post per day, so anons could reset their certs daily if they so chose, but still enough to deal with spammers.  I'll be researching it with an eye to implementing something like it as soon as I can.

>>87925a1a-16fc-4afa-926a-28a7e00e12b4
And you were right.  I said that because I trust in the ability of people to keep illegal shit off their computers, and to deal with minor issues while the site is discussing upgrades.  From that viewpoint its really irrelevant if you're using TOR or not.  I didn't expect literal Dailybeast articles about an obscure bunker for a mongolian cave painting discussion forum and trying to hunt down people who weren't committing crimes.  It was naive, and I will fix it.

In the meantime, a whole shitload of people came here - exactly what 08chan is for.

==Known Issues==

>Image uploading via TOR is currently broken.  A temp fix for thumbnails was found, but there is a permanent solution to be found in upgrading 08chan's base code.  This must be done very carefully to not cripple the site, and some anons from /tech/ are experimenting with it.

>~~If we're here for more than a few days, we will start implementing quality of life improvements and code upgrades.~~  It seems we're going to be stuck here for a while so we're going to move forward with this.

>The Mute function has been working fine since the time of the last tests.  To Unmute a user, go to ZeroHello and access the large "3 vertical dots" menu in the upper left corner, and choose "Manage Blocked Users".  Feel free to test the Mute functionality and make sure it is working properly.  Report bugs here.

>Zeronet as a whole is not fully compatible with certain browsers like Opera, and there's nothing we can do about that.  I'm sorry.

>Script blockers can have a terrible effect on basic site functions.  Make sure you whitelist the site in Noscript and other systems.

>Gab launched a Tweetchain about this site in the early hours of August 6th, which exploded on Twitter.  Site traffic is currently ramping up by the hour.  If the site is slowing down for you, consider enabling the "Download and Help Distribute All Files" option in your 0 menu with a limit of 500mb and a file size limit of 20mb.  This will speed the site back up to its normal rate at the cost of some disk space.

==IT IS STRONGLY RECOMMENDED THAT YOU POST AND BROWSE ONLY VIA TOR OR A VPN.==
The Daily Beast published a hitpiece about us today that revealed (((certain people))) are harvesting IPs from concurrent connections for purposes unknown. 

==THE SITE NOW REQUIRES A ZEROID CERTIFICATE TO POST==
This ID can be acquired by using ZeroNet over the clearnet just long enough to visit 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ 
This will give you a new, one-time certificate so you can post.  To activate it, get the cert and then open the "0" menu in the upper right, and select Change next to "Identity Address."  Choose the ZeroID cert.  Update the site, reload the page and be patient and you should be able to post again.  We are attempting a fix to allow new users to access old content from before this change.

>It is possible to run all of ZeroNet from inside a Veracrypt Encrypted File Container.  I strongly recommend making such a container and only mounting it during the times you are using ZeroNet, and unmounting it when you finish.  This is slightly RAM-intensive, so it may not be an option if you have a toaster, but will give you maximum personal protection if you inadvertently download something you shouldn't have.

==I HAVE ALSO IDENTIFIED A BUG IN THE [M] FUNCTION.==

 If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them.  If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted.  If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters.  Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually.

We've had no other bug reports apart from the slowness caused by so many leechers, but I found this a bit ago when I muted a porn spammer on /b/ as a test.  His folder had over 1000 files in it between thumbnails and images from a single thread.  We will investigate this bug as well.

posts.subject: Test
posts.body: Does this publish?

Okay, so we're at least halfway there.  With 08chan certs disabled, my 08chan ID thats whitelisted was still able to publish.

Here's the steps we need to complete:

>08chan certs that are whitelisted can publish
>New 08chan certs can not
>ZeroID certs can publish without issue
>ZeroID certs can download and see what 08chan certs had posted

>>710d0433-0c5d-416d-b1c4-2b51c1500579

That content.json file that was updated still had 08chan listed under cert signers.  I removed that line and commented 08chan permissions to True instead of false.

Since I have the master fileset it ''always'' looks like everything goes through on my end.  Having other people test posts and give me feedback on what works and doesn't is critical.

New thread for people with toasters and/or the old thread got too big.

>>2b37a307-e938-4de3-8914-7fbc674c7abb

I've seen no CP on the board period, but my hope is the new patch also fixed that bug.  I just don't want to remove the warning from the sticky until we have multiple confirmations.

>>97b05e38-84c6-4244-8ae3-0afda53c9511

Boards can't be removed since everything is distributed.  The solution is to blacklist those boards yourself.

Imagine the alternative.  If a board could be removed, then /pol/ could be removed.  That would defeat the purpose of an uncensorable bunker even existing.  I do have a few tweaks I want to do to the site over the course of this week, once everyone is updated and the site is stable, but its things like the announcement text, firsthand bug testing, and updating the FAQ and info links from Millchan's to ours.

posts.body: The ID system is somewhat regrettable, but its also a key component of being able to moderate your own computer.  It can be obfuscated, but without a total redesign of the site there's no real workaround, and the workaround (something like a function that hashed a new ID for each post) would only really be a bandaid.  The folder bloat would also be enormous.

>>66443064-30b8-4a75-bcf2-e73e0c6e70ad
Works as intended for me.

>>c72a8596-5078-4038-8ea6-ff0ab4780426
Its not exactly a bug, its just that there may be some very old files that nobody is seeding anymore.  Even I deleted and relaunched 08chan at least once back when we were testing it a year ago and lost a few things.  6-10 sounds about right, so I wouldn't worry about it.

>>7e3aec62-7605-42b1-8d22-366bb1844dba
They ''literally can't be deleted'' because they're not in one unified place to "delete" them from.  ZeroNet doesn't work like a normal website.  ''In theory'' I could globally blacklist those boards by hardcoding their hashes into a blacklist in users/content.json and forcing an update, but making another board is as simple as clicking a button.  It does nothing that Muting the board yourself doesn't do.

The price of freedom is vigilance.  You are responsible for what you see and what you seed here.  Be responsible.

posts.subject: Admin Here
posts.body: I'll be looking into adding additional file capabilities this week.  .zip, .rar, and several others are already on the to-do list.  Hang tight.

>>e190dbdd-5c39-4d64-829e-1be2e42c579a
>but, I can't see everything being uploaded to this site at every given moment.

And that's why you aren't downloading everything from the site at every moment.  The only ones at risk of this problem are those running "Download and Seed All" without blacklisting the boards in question first, and even I'm not that crazy.  You only download what you personally see.  So if you see it, hit the [M].

There is a thread and post blacklist function that I can use if I personally see offending content, but even that is opt-in by the users.  See that little checkbox at the bottom that says "Enable Blacklist"?  If you uncheck it and refresh, you can even see posts that I've blacklisted as the admin.

I'm sorry this bothers you (genuinely, no sarcasm) but censorship proof ''means censorship proof.''  I have very little power here and no interest in having more.  Once the site is stable, tweaked, and updated, I'm looking forward to never even using my capcode again and just posting as anon.

>>429068c8-b484-49cc-9a2f-128738cf4fa1
It's not supposed to, no.  That would put a rather hefty penalty on users willing to help the community by opting to "Download and Seed All" by making self moderation much harder.
This is a good thread and I'll be keeping my eye on it.

>>d024590c-8363-495d-85a7-d88bebdc9671
>Site chugs
A consequence of the TOR browser fix.  Supposedly there's another update coming to the base code that improves speed back to where it was or faster, so we're waiting on that.  In the meantime you can actually post images over TOR.  If the site is "chugging" you may need to run "download and seed all" for a little while and get more of it.  For me, catalogs load in ~6 seconds and threads load in ~3.

>Long threads overload browsers
Again, this doesn't happen for everyone.  I've seen 2 complaints about it so far.  In the old announcement, my browser would slow down for ~10 seconds and then work normally.
>>Board pinning is hit and miss (Mostly miss) where some boards will allow me to pin them and others won't
This is new.  I'll look into it.
>Clicking post numbers cause the entire page to reload with link to said post absent in the replay box
If you're clicking from outside the thread its supposed to work that way.  Inside the thread, clicking their post number should open the quick reply box with their post tagged already.
>700+ files will not download after redownloading the entire site
There may not be anyone on at that precise moment seeding them.  Considering the total files is upwards of 49 gigabytes, you're not doing bad.
>Explain to me, HOW is this update better?

Inline post bug fixed, TOR image posting fixed, post deletion enabled, memory leak fixed, more browsing options (like "spoiler all images" for the extra wary) and controllable paging, WITH the ZeroID spam protection and posting errors between certs staying fixed.

posts.subject: Bug Testing Report
posts.body:
I've been browsing and posting all evening from TOR instead of my usual VPN, just to make sure I'm seeing what you all are seeing.

The site loads fast.  Pages load fast.  Threads load fast.  /pol/'s catalog loads in ~4 seconds.  I'm getting almost no slowdown and all functions seem to work 100%.

This is via Linux / TOR browser (current ver) / Tor: Always in ZeroHello with the Linux TOR enabling instructions from ZeroNet applied.  Showing 10/15 trackers.  No bugs from the main end yet.

This is both good and bad.  Good in that it seems that everything at the upstream level updated fine and works.  Bad in that it will be harder to figure out what is causing problems for those individual users who ARE having issues, because its a "works on my machine" scenario.

>>cec12fdc-5d30-4e88-abf2-3e708a2c91cd
I used to be a fan of Palemoon, but it IS based on an old fork of Firefox and is known to have memory leak issues.  I had to stop using it because opening a large thread on Fullchan would cause it to freeze up back in the day.  Sound familiar?  It says right in the announcement that not all browsers are supported ''by ZeroNet'', which includes the implementations of it used to make this place and Millchan.  I'm genuinely happy that you got it figured out, but  Experimental Darknet 8chan is going to have its quirks and issues.  Some of them we're going to be able to fix for you, some will get fixed when Millchan updates the core code (since nobody knows their system better than the people who made it), and some like less-popular browser compatibility may never get fixed.

>>88b26af7-7759-44fc-bd66-e7b6dfdc94c4
Thats partly what this thread is for, so please go ahead.

>>caf6520b-8d7f-4e37-97eb-4a8911639121
That's fairly normal, yes.  Since the site has to store and seed everything you see, it takes up a fair chunk of RAM to run and quite a bit of disc space.  My file for 08chan is around 11GB.

That's the tradeoff for an uncensorable site.  There's no server and no hosting costs to pay, but in return everyone has to donate some RAM and drive space to keep it running.

posts.subject: Current Site Situation and Minor Code Update
posts.body:
==GREETINGS==

Current SITREP regarding 8chan is that it is alive and active at the new address of https://8kun.top

Ron and Jim have constructed their own DDoS mitigation system that (so far) seems to be doing an adequate job of keeping the site up and stable.  Some of the communities have returned and overall the site seems usable with only occasional glitches do to ongoing improvements and bug testing.

For what it may be worth to you, 8chan is back.

==THE STATE OF THIS SITE AND ITS MAINTENANCE==

One of the virtues about using ZeroNet is that it does not require much active work on the part of any sort of administrator or moderators.  Nevertheless, I have no intention of going anywhere.  I took a vacation for a few days due to overwork and stress.  I'm not and haven't pretended to be a code developer, but I'm not afraid to work with anons to continue making this place more of a home for the people that use it.  You have no fear of this place disappearing.

On that last subject, I'm sure you've all noticed that the number of active posters has greatly diminished.  The difficulty of using 08chan "properly", that is to say the necessary steps to enable TOR, secure your files, and protect your anonymity, seem to be too much of a burden for anons as long as clearnet bunkers like vch.moe remain relevant.  Compounding this is the paranoia over "CP", which frightens casual onlookers away.  And the slightly hefty system and download requirements to not have the site run like a slow piece of shit in the browser also precludes people with low-performance computers from using it.

 These are issues we would do well to address is some fashion if we can.  I'm unconcerned with site metrics personally;  We have no advertisers to please, no money to make, and no hosting providers to fear here.  But having more people to talk to is always nice.

posts.subject: Updates
posts.body:
==GREETINGS==

So as many of you know, Frederick Brennan (once known as Hotwheels, 8chan's admin) has been on a months-long autism crusade against Jim Watkins, 8chan's current owner.  Jim and his son Ron are the pair most responsible for 8chan, and have been trying to bring the site back using an in-house developed DDoS mitigation schema after Cloudflare deplatformed them.  Brennan and a cabal of journos have been working together to deplatform the new 8chan site, "8kun" from every hosting provider that has initially taken them in.  The site currently remains down, with Brennan going so far as to threaten to release an open-source flood script to target the site if it does come back up.  Consensus among the other bunkers seems to be "a fall down an eternal escalator is too good for the cuck now."  Nevertheless, 8chan remains down.  

==MINOR SITE UPDATE HERE==

A few minutes ago I pushed an update to users/content.json to enable uploading of common archive formats (zip, rar, tar, 7z) and also raw text files (txt).  This is somewhat dubious, as three previous attempts caused massive issues on my end.  Please give this change plenty of time to propagate, make sure your site files are updated, and report any bugs or problems here.

posts.subject: UPDATE
posts.body:
==GREETINGS==

So as many of you know, Frederick Brennan (once known as Hotwheels, 8chan's admin) has been on a months-long autism crusade against Jim Watkins, 8chan's current owner.  Jim and his son Ron are the pair most responsible for 8chan, and have been trying to bring the site back using an in-house developed DDoS mitigation schema after Cloudflare deplatformed them.  Brennan and a cabal of journos have been working together to deplatform the new 8chan site, "8kun" from every hosting provider that has initially taken them in.  The site currently remains down, with Brennan going so far as to threaten to release an open-source flood script to target the site if it does come back up.  Consensus among the other bunkers seems to be "a fall down an eternal escalator is too good for the cuck now."  Nevertheless, 8chan remains down.  

==MINOR SITE UPDATE HERE==

A few minutes ago I pushed an update to users/content.json to enable uploading of common archive formats (zip, rar, tar, 7z) and also raw text files (txt).  This is somewhat dubious, as three previous attempts caused massive issues on my end.  Please give this change plenty of time to propagate, make sure your site files are updated, and report any bugs or problems here.


==THE STATE OF THIS SITE AND ITS MAINTENANCE==

One of the virtues about using ZeroNet is that it does not require much active work on the part of any sort of administrator or moderators.  Nevertheless, I have no intention of going anywhere.  I took a vacation for a few days due to overwork and stress.  I'm not and haven't pretended to be a code developer, but I'm not afraid to work with anons to continue making this place more of a home for the people that use it.  You have no fear of this place disappearing.

On that last subject, I'm sure you've all noticed that the number of active posters has greatly diminished.  The difficulty of using 08chan "properly", that is to say the necessary steps to enable TOR, secure your files, and protect your anonymity, seem to be too much of a burden for anons as long as clearnet bunkers like vch.moe remain relevant.  Compounding this is the paranoia over "CP", which frightens casual onlookers away.  And the slightly hefty system and download requirements to not have the site run like a slow piece of shit in the browser also precludes people with low-performance computers from using it.

 These are issues we would do well to address is some fashion if we can.  I'm unconcerned with site metrics personally;  We have no advertisers to please, no money to make, and no hosting providers to fear here.  But having more people to talk to is always nice.

Honestly I've been doing some thinking and a few ideas have come to mind:

There are several ZeroNet sites that have "portals" on the clearnet.  Basically ZeroNet proxies that let people browse a ZN site from the clearnet without downloading any files.  If we established such a proxy we could ask that it be added to the 8chan bunker webring, and that would let anons stay in touch with us here and drive traffic.  The proxy would need to be configured to mitigate spam/CP risk, something like deleting its entire file cache every few hours and starting over, plus the highest security settings (like "spoiler all" and "always spoiler").  You know fuckers would abuse it otherwise.

Another option would be a bundle installer.  A single file that would installVeracrypt, ZeroNet, TOR browser, and a basic set of 08chan's files, and then configure everything for you via a simple script.  

Alternatively, there is a ZeroNet app for Android that seems to work quite well.  We could encourage phonefags to spread awareness of it and make use of it.

==TOR BROWSER JUST PUSHED AN UPDATE TO VERSION 9.0 THAT BROKE MY ZERONET COMPATIBILITY==

~~Do NOT update TOR browser until we have an idea what just happened!~~

==FIX FOUND==

Open TOR Browser and type about:config into the address bar.  Accept the disclaimer.  In the search box type "no_proxies" and you'll see an entry called "no_proxies_on".  Double click this entry and enter the string 127.0.0.1

Save and exit, and ZeroNet will work again.  This option was removed from the normal configuration menu and then the update reset it to defaults.  Its almost like they broke ZeroNet compatibility on purpose, the fuckers.

==TOR BROWSER JUST PUSHED AN UPDATE TO VERSION 9.0 THAT BROKE MY ZERONET COMPATIBILITY==

posts.subject: Possible 8kun Exodus Incoming
posts.body:
Winds may be changing.  I haven't caught up all the details yet because of the avalanche of he-said-she-said going on, but the gist of it seems to be as follows:

>8kun site has been having problems, and Jim and Ron have been backburnering the site and dragging their feet fixing things in favor of a sort of "Infinity Next" generation upgrade to the overall code.
>They have kept users largely in the dark about this, so complaints have been mounting.
>Markjew, the BO of /v/, brought the issue to a head with Jim Watkins and several things came out of it.
>Jim apparently doesn't care about /v/, or perhaps any of the boards apart from the policed news boards and the Qboomers.
>Jim considers 2D loli to be the same as CP.  A few here might agree with this in principle but its also setting off the free speech canary warnings sitewide.  Censorship always starts somewhere and its the low-hanging fruit.
>Jim's justification was to get on friendly terms with local media because 8kun exists "to sell advertising to customers."
>When /v/'s BO pressed the issue harder he was summarily fired and lost ownership of his board.  In retaliation he began dumping his private conversations with the 8kun admins to back up his claims.
>Other BOs took note of this and the drama intensified.  Bunkers are being activated and there's talk of a mass exodus.

8chan's revival may be far more short lived than we might have hoped for.  For my part I check in on this place weekly to download the latest files and seed the master back to our network nodes.  Several half-started backburner projects for this place still exist, and those may be reactivated if we see an influx of activity, including a clearnet portal with anonymous posting.

>>082d841a-379c-434b-b67a-2c4a48e96307
Checking in while working on other web projects.  The site looks nominally fine if loading a bit slower than normal.  Whats the issue?

>>1ebe9e6f-0cb2-4c16-893c-1edcc9307556
I think my install may have partially corrupted.  Loading even a single page takes several minutes and my console shows a large number of broken pipe errors and errors such as:

 Unhandled exception: [(<type 'exceptions.AttributeError'>, AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'ip'",), <traceback object at 0x7fe06fb4e560>)]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gevent/greenlet.py", line 536, in run
    result = self._run(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/media/veracrypt1/ZeroNet-master/src/Peer/Peer.py", line 343, in findHashIds
    back[hash].append((self.connection.ip, self.connection.port))
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'ip'
[21:45:59] ConnServer Internet offline
[21:46:02] Site:1ADQAH..g6aA Error deleting data/users/15WU4yNYwiDGWp1wxCDRu9PmgzVmdxiULW/53a3d181f4f4222f871a0f860e5024a600005f0f-thumb.jpg: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: './data/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/data/users/15WU4yNYwiDGWp1wxCDRu9PmgzVmdxiULW/53a3d181f4f4222f871a0f860e5024a600005f0f-thumb.jpg'

These were always present to some extent ever since the ZeroID fix to restore the original site content from before the spammer attack, but for some reason they have become debilitating.  The problem persists in both Firefox and Tor browser.  There's also the matter of ZeroHello failing to update over 100,000 files here, which is a new issue to me.

I've backed up the master seed for 08 and will probably do a fresh install of Zeronet on a new computer soon.  This toaster is about ready to retire anyway and an upgrade with a fresh OS and all updated software will hopefully fix the issue.

I'm currently working on two projects:  The most relevant is a clearnet proxy portal to allow access to 08 from anywhere.  The other is a WAN architecture to allow a clearnet landing site to funnel users to a specific tor hidden service running on a different, concealed machine.  This could allow the clearnet site and its server and domain to have full deniability against takedowns and deplatforming (as they host no content, objectionable or otherwise) while also avoiding the tracking and datamining problems that are plentiful with tor open proxies.  If both of these work out, then next it should also be possible to clone ZeroID's system to have our own, in-house cert generation too.  That's been a long term goal ever since the spam attack.

I know I only post rarely, but I do bring up the main seed and update my files every couple of weeks.  This place is in no way abandoned.  The fact is, 08 doesn't need me.  If it did, ''then'' it would be a failure.
